column2: 1.2 How much experience do you have professionally developing GUIs?
column3: 1.3 What platform(s) do you primarily develop GUIs for? (Select all that apply)
column4: 1.4 How often do you use AI-powered code generation tools in GUI development?
column5: 1.5  How often do you use AI-powered design-to-code tools (e.g., Builder.io, Anima, Locofy.ai, UI2Code.ai)?
column6: 2.1 Available GUI tools (e.g., IDEs, UI frameworks) lack sufficient capabilities for my needs.
column7: 2.2 It is hard to find GUI development information (e.g., documentation, community support).
column8: 2.3 Managing dependencies and libraries (e.g., components, icons) is complicated.
column9: 2.4 Continuous learning is essential to maintain competency due to rapid evolution of GUI technologies.
column10: 2.5 Designer-developer communication is unclear or ineffective, leading to rework.
column11: 2.6 Working with legacy GUI code is frustrating and demotivating.
column12: 2.7 The hardware resources are insufficient for GUI development.
column13: 2.8 Lack of a clear architectural pattern makes GUI maintenance difficult.
column14: 2.9 Implementing responsive layouts across devices is complicated.
column15: 2.10  Achieving high GUI performance requires excessive optimization.
column16: 2.11 Implementing components and styles from designs is difficult.
column17: 2.12 Implementing data binding and component interactions is difficult.
column18: 2.13 Debugging GUI code requires significant effort.
column19: 2.14 Design-to-code tools (Builder.io, Anima, Locofy.ai, UI2Code.ai â€? can correctly recognize the GUI elements and generate corresponding code.
column20: 2.15 Design-to-code tools (Builder.io, Anima, Locofy.ai, UI2Code.ai â€? do not integrate well into workflows.
column21: 2.16 AI code tools lack contextual understanding of GUI development.
column22: 2.17 AI code tools do not fully support GUI-domain-specific languages and frameworks.
column23: 2.18 AI-generated code is hard to debug and maintain.
column24: 2.19  There are proper development methods to ensure accessibility.
column26: 2.21 GUI development tools help make GUIs accessible.
column27: Please describe any obstacles not covered above, particularly related to tools, workflows, or collaboration.
column28: 3.2 What improvement to a tool, framework, or team process would most improve your GUI development workflow?
